snippet: Always a fan favorite at the United States Open, and the 2003 champion, Andy Roddick headed into retirement with a 6-7 (1), 7-6 (4), 6-2, 6-4 loss to Juan Martín del Potro.
abstract: Andy Roddick heads into retirement after losing his fourth-round match against Juan Martin del Potro at the United States Open; over his 12-year professional career, Roddick won 612 tour singles matches and 32 singles titles, including the 2003 United States Open.
lead_paragraph: Always a fan favorite at the United States Open, and the 2003 champion, Andy Roddick headed into retirement with a 6-7 (1), 7-6 (4), 6-2, 6-4 loss to Juan Martín del Potro.

headline.seo: Roddick, at a Loss for Words, Leaves Behind a Career of Superlatives
headline.main: Roddick, at a Loss for Words, Leaves Behind a Career of Superlatives
headline.print_headline: Roddick, at a Loss for Words, Leaves Behind a Career of Superlatives
